text:
Q: Being redirect to project base home after .htaccess change A:

What’s most likely happening is that Chrome has remembered a permanent redirect for that specific URL. Because the rule returned a 301, Chrome cached it and keeps applying it even though you’ve reverted the .htaccess file. That’s why the page works in Incognito or in Brave (they don’t share the same cache), but not in your regular Chrome profile. To fix it, open Chrome DevTools, go to the Network tab, enable Disable cache, then do an Empty Cache and Hard Reload on /admin/maintenance (or clear “Cached images and files” for all time). If your app uses a PWA or service worker, also check DevTools → Application → Service Workers and unregister it, since service workers can cache or rewrite specific routes. In the future, use 302 or 307 redirects while testing, and only use 301 when you’re sure the redirect should be permanent.

Q: I am trying to run the Google ADK but it shows command 'adk' not found A:

I also faced the same issue and i fixed it in few steps

1.Make sure you have installed python version 3.9 or above of that if not then upgrade it with these command

  1. sudo apt update

  2. sudo apt install python3.9

  3. python3.9 (for verification)

  4. Verify you adk installation with this command

pip show web adk

still your adk is tie with python 3.8 then

upgrade your python version in pycharm IDE if you have. here is the pathway to upgrade it

go to your project in pycharm

In my case it is like

PycharmProjects/multi_tool_agent->settings -> project (name is mentioned here like multi_tool_agent) -> python Interpreter -> add Interpretor -> local Interpretor -> select the python version 3.9 or above of that.

  1. Upgrade your pip if needed then with this command
python -m pip install  --upgrade pip
  1. web adk

Now might be you are facing the issue for python multipart

installed it from the terminal with this command

pip install python multipart

if still it is not working for you then installed in pycharm itself using this pathway

similar to here

PycharmProjects/multi_tool_agent->settings -> project (name is mentioned here like multi_tool_agent) -> python Interpreter -> select python multipart 0.0.20

or click on this link

Python FastAPI package python-multipart installed but not found

Again run this command on terminal

web adk

it will run successfully

and navigate to http://127.0.0.1:8000/dev-ui/?app=multi_tool_agent&session=cf4adb56-7603-4a52-8f9d-0a1eb227ba88 to use multi_tool_agent

python -m pip install --upgrade pip

Q: SEGW Mapping on GetEntitySet (Query) setup for date range data A:

I assume that you using abap query to get items. You need to manually add filter to your abap query like below:

  data:  LR_OBJECT type range of TDOBJECT,
         LR_ID     type range of TDID,
         LR_SPRAS  type range of TDSPRAS.

  loop at IT_FILTER_SELECT_OPTIONS assigning field-symbol(<FS_FILTER>).
    case <FS_FILTER>-PROPERTY.
      when 'OBJECT'.
        LR_OBJECT = value #( for WA in <FS_FILTER>-SELECT_OPTIONS (
                       SIGN   = WA-SIGN
                       OPTION = WA-OPTION
                       LOW    = WA-LOW
                       HIGH   = WA-HIGH ) ).
      when 'ID'.
        LR_ID = value #( for WA in <FS_FILTER>-SELECT_OPTIONS (
             SIGN   = WA-SIGN
             OPTION = WA-OPTION
             LOW    = WA-LOW
             HIGH   = WA-HIGH ) ).
      when 'SPRAS'.
        LR_SPRAS = value #( for WA in <FS_FILTER>-SELECT_OPTIONS (
             SIGN   = WA-SIGN
             OPTION = WA-OPTION
             LOW    = WA-LOW
             HIGH   = WA-HIGH ) ).
    endcase.
  endloop.

    select *
      from MYTABLE
      into corresponding fields of table @LT_ITAB
      up to @IS_PAGING-TOP rows
    where TDOBJECT in @LR_OBJECT
      and TDID     in @LR_ID
      and TDSPRAS  in @LR_SPRAS.
